"Your true self is, in fact, exceedingly similar to a self suitable for the woman personated by the `Hot Nerd Girl' costume," says "Ingrid."

"What the eff does that mean?" you ask.

"She means that at heart, in your mind and soul, you really are a hot nerd girl, Jake," says Christina. "Or close enough not to matter. So the costume made you into one. For keeps."

"Whose side are you on, anyway, Christina?" you ask her, angry at both girls now.

"This is exceedingly rare, sir," says "Ingrid." She sighs. "We're doing as much for you as we can, despite very limited legal obligations. You'll be near enough yourself again tomorrow afternoon. Perhaps the young lady and I can find some additional clothes for you to wear in the meantime."

You feel somewhat abandoned as Christina and "Ingrid" disappear into the back rooms. You hear distant giggles and laughter, and in about fifteen minutes they return, Christina laden with several big shopping bags -- surely containing more than a change or two of clothes for your newly female body. The girls actually kiss before Christina offloads the bags onto you and hustles you out of the shop.

"We're going to my place, Jake," she says.
1312221.title: "I'm afraid not, sir."

13122211.content:
Christina's place is closer to the shop than yours is. It's tiny and she lives there alone. Her living room couch folds out to reveal not too bad a bed -- which takes up most of the living room.

"You and that fake Ingrid seemed to get pretty damned friendly back there," you say, the tones of a jealous boy marring your beautiful female voice.

"She's actually a nice lady," says Christina, "not the bitch I thought she was. I mean, I don't blame her for wanting to see a young Ingrid Bergman in the mirror. She even gave me some costumes for free!"

"Probably you'll get stuck in them," you say.

"She's scanned my body and there'll be a Christina suit ready along with your Jake one," she says, "if the very worst happens. Or... we could be each other! You should try being me for a week or two, Jake!" To your amazement, that actually seems a pretty good idea, and Christina correctly interprets your silence as approval -- or at least not outright disapproval -- of the idea. "It'll be so cool living each other's lives, Jake! You'll be able to appreciate me from the inside, too!"

Soon you're at Christina's apartment. She leaves you in the tiny living room with one of the bags. "Clothes for you, Jake: nightgown, some girl clothes in just your size for tomorrow. We'll stop at your apartment tomorrow to get a change of clothes that fits your Jake shape."

"And the other bags..."

"Three new mes!" she says, and steps briskly into her bedroom, locking the door behind herself.

You fold out the sofa bed. Christina has a set of clean-looking linen already on it. You don't figure you'll be getting any girl-on-girl action with Christina: she's never shown any signs of liking that. You undress and confirm from your reflection in the entryway mirror, needlessly, that your body looks perfectly female from the outside: maybe a gynecologist would find some of the necessary bits missing, but you doubt it: you're all girl. You sigh like the pretty woman you've become and put on the nightgown from the bag: it's flannel and comfortable without looking too dowdy.

13122211.title: You don't argue.

131222111.content:
"Ingrid," the shopgirl who Christina says is a copy of the young Ingrid Bergman brought up to date, is dressed exactly as she was at the shop. "Ah, there you are, sir," she says, and for a few seconds you're sure that somehow this is the shopgirl herself. But in response to your stunned expression she giggles Christina's cute and distinctive giggle -- though at the wrong pitch -- and says, "Had you going there for a bit, didn't I, Jake?" She has the other woman's voice but she's definitely Christina. "I didn't have to tear the skin off her! She gave me a copy of it to wear, and I sort of hope I do get stuck this way!"

"I wish I weren't a girl," you tell her.

"Yes, usually I don't like other girls," says Christina in her unfamiliar voice from her unfamiliar body. "She also gave me this!" She shows you what she's holding in her left hand. Both the hand -- lovely, but so much not Christina's -- and the object catch your interest. It's a little pendant on a necklace chain, rather like an amulet, depicting two very female figures sixty-nined together, the bodies apparently in mutual orgasm. "Instant lesbianism! As long as I wear it, I'm pure dyke!"

"Christina, you don't have to--"

It's as if you were born a girl and grew up into a woman. But it's not just your gender that seems normal and right and comfortable now. The feel of breasts on your chest and no male parts at your crotch is just... normal now -- you realize that only when you think idly about putting on the Jake suit you're scheduled to get this afternoon, and find that you don't want to.
